page.title: 10Gardens in Willingham
page.content: Most front{gardens}are quite small and enclosed and contain mainly flowers and shrubs. Because of ribbon development along the main through routes most back gardens in Willingham tend to be quite large where they border onto open fields. There is usually an area of lawn and some trees. Many gardens have{vegetable {plots,}the main crops being beans, peas, potatoes, beetroot, cabbages, carrots, broccoli and cauliflowers. Soft fruit bushes are also quite common and the soil is very suitable for growing strawberries. {Surplus produce}is frequently offered for sale by the garden gate with a tin left for the money. There are some{allotments}to rent from the Parish Council. {Greenhouses}abound, including some devoted to commercial growing.
